repnme.cdata!:
Pakistan - Fordwah Eastern Sadiqia (South)
            Irrigation and Drainage Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the Fordwah
            Eastern Sadiqia (South) Irrigation and Drainage Project is
            satisfactory. Lessons learned from this project include: a)
            Farmers willingly contribute to capital and operation and
            maintenance (O&M) costs when they are involved in all
            phases of project cycle. b) Turnover of management of
            irrigation systems to formal farmer organizations lead to
            improved equity of water distribution, cost-effective
            O&M, and improved O&M cost recovery. c) Project
            interventions that require up-front capital cost
            contributions by farmers should have effective linkages with
            micro-credit facilities. d) Capital cost sharing should take
            into account the social and other disparities between
            different farm sizes and income groups. e) Effective
            monitoring arrangements should be in place within
            implementing agencies to ensure that procurement processes
            are completed within a reasonable time frame. f) Investments
            in high-cost sub-surface drainage interventions should be
            preceded by interventions in water conservation, surface
            drainage, and improved water management, accompanied by a
            monitoring program to identify the residual subsurface
            drainage requirements. g) Investments in canal lining should
            be preceded by field investigations. h) For waterlogged
            saline groundwater areas along canals, a system of
            inter-connected subsurface interceptor and tile drains
            should be considered. i) Resettlement action plans should be
            developed through a consultative planning process.

18156262.theme: Water resource management,Pollution management and environmental health,Rural services and infrastructure
18156262.majtheme: Environment and natural resource management,Rural development

repnme.cdata!:
Pakistan - Fordwah Eastern Sadiqia (South)
            Irrigation and Drainage Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project is located in one of the
            least developed areas of the Punjab province.  It is the
            Government's first effort to control waterlogging and
            salinity through improved water management.  Besides
            removing severe water supply constraints by increasing
            delivery efficiency of canals and watercourses, it will
            control excessive seepage and provide surface drainage. The
            main objectives are to: a) increase agricultural
            productivity and income; b) reduce the need for expensive
            subsurface drainage and avert related environmentally
            harmful effects; and c) improve the equity of water
            distribution.  To achieve these objectives the project will:
            1) conserve water by: i) recovering a significant amount of
            seepage from the larger channels by installing interceptor
            drains; and ii) preventing seepage from distributaries and
            minors by providing impervious lining and improving
            watercourses; 2) provide a network of surface drains in the
            area to evacuate storm water run off; 3) carry out research
            on technical and management issues crucial for irrigation
            and drainage subsectors; 4) provide technical assistance to
            ensure adequate back-up for implementing agencies and train
            project staff; and 5) monitor and evaluate the
            project's impact on groundwater tables and agricultural production.
